frontmatter.title: What you need to get scenario replays in your product
frontmatter.preview: In the previous article I described how scenario replays improve development and cross-team workflows. Now, we start to dive in how they work with a high-level overview of what they are and what they need to able to do.

frontmatter.title: Scenario replays and how they improve workflows across teams
frontmatter.preview: With the right setup, it becomes possible to replay actions a user might take to jump specific points in a UI. This allows developers to get things done quicker and collaborate more fluidly with designers, QA and other teams.

frontmatter.title: Structuring your back-end for rapid iteration during development
frontmatter.preview: When developing, it can be very useful to start your back-end in different states with different data sets. If you want to go the next level, you can also go to the next level allowing multiple instances of your back-end to run in the same process, allowing you to display your application in different states at the same time.

frontmatter.title: Designing modern web development workflows
frontmatter.preview: Web development has gone through many technological iterations. Here I ask questions about what we'd want from an ideal experience, not only from the perspective of developers, but for the entire organization. And, there's some thoughts on how to get there.
